definition: to cook food in an oven without extra fat or liquid; to be cooked in this way
to become hard when heated; to make something hard by heating it
to be or become very hot
clever and humorous
able to think quickly; intelligent
to come out of an egg
to break open so that a young bird, fish, insect, etc. can come out
to make a young bird, fish, insect, etc. come out of an egg
to create a plan or an idea, especially in secret
you should not be too confident that something will be successful, because something may still go wrong
the top outside floor of a ship or boat
one of the floors of a ship or a bus
a floor or platform similar to the deck of a ship
a complete set of 52 playing cards
a wooden floor that is built outside the back of a house where you can sit and relax
a part of a sound system that records and/or plays sounds on a disc or tape
a set of slides (= pages created on a computer that contain text and images) that are used to accompany a person’s presentation
everyone helps or must help, especially in a difficult situation
to prepare for an activity, event, etc. by removing anything that is not essential to it
to fall to the ground
a device that makes a loud noise to warn ships of danger in fog
a flag flown on a ship to show which country it belongs to
an officer of low rank in the US navy
a tall pole on a boat or ship that supports the sails
a tall metal tower with an aerial that sends and receives radio, television or phone signals
a tall pole that is used for holding a flag
to say publicly and clearly what you believe or who you support
a machine for lifting or pulling heavy objects using a rope or chain
an underground railway system in a city
a path that goes under a road, etc. which people can use to cross to the other side
used to express a doubt or choice between two possibilities
used to show that something is true in either of two cases
a light motorcycle, usually with small wheels and a curved cover at the front to protect the rider’s legs

a vehicle, powered by an electric motor, with two or three small wheels attached to a narrow board with a handle that rises straight up at the front. The person riding it holds the handle and stands on the board.

a vehicle, used especially by children, with two or three small wheels attached to a narrow board with a handle that rises straight up at the front. The rider holds the handle, puts one foot on the board and pushes against the ground with the other.
what you see when you cut through the middle of something so that you can see the different layers it is made of; a drawing of this view
a group of people or things that are typical of a larger group
connected with the system of spelling in a language
to draw, photograph, etc. objects or people so that they look smaller or closer together than they really are
to end something before it would normally finish
